page.title: 08HUTTON ESTATE - DEER
page.content: Most of the deer on the estate are roe deer, and it is estimated that the resident population is about 80 head. They frequently move about because of disturbance. Furthermore, they damage young trees. The estate has a policy of culling the deer to ensure a healthy stock and to keep damage to trees to an acceptable level. This is now mainly done by Mr M Fitzpatrick of the Leeming House Hotel. Very occasionally a red deer stag can be seen - one was seen in Dukes Wood in 1980. No doubt they are roaming from Martindale to Askham Fells.
